info.title: Cyoda API
info.description:
API for Cyoda, providing access to entity management, search capabilities, SQL schema operations, and more.

## Core Capabilities

### Entity Management
APIs for managing entities including creation, updates, and statistics retrieval.
All changes are executed transactionally with collections processed in transactional batches.

### Entity Model
Operations for managing entity models, including import/export, versioning, and lifecycle management.
Supports model locking/unlocking, change level control, and metadata conversion through various formats.

Model Lifecycle Rules:
- Entity models must be locked before any entities can be saved using that model
- A locked model cannot be unlocked if there are existing entities in the database using that model
- Models can only be deleted when unlocked and when no entities reference them

Change Level Control:
Models support hierarchical change levels (from least to most impactful):
- ARRAY_LENGTH: Only allows UniTypeArray width increases
- ARRAY_ELEMENTS: Permits MultiTypeArray changes without new types
- TYPE: Allows type modifications
- STRUCTURAL: Permits fundamental model changes

When a change level is set, all less impactful changes are automatically allowed.

### Search
Provides endpoints for searching and retrieving entities using both synchronous and asynchronous approaches.

Key Features:
- Snapshot-based searches for large datasets
- Real-time synchronous searches for immediate results
- Point-in-time querying capabilities
- Pagination support for large result sets

Search Methods:
1. Snapshot Search (/snapshot/*):
   - Creates a persistent snapshot of search results
   - The query is distributed across the cluster of Cyoda processing nodes
   - Horizontally scalable - query time decreases linearly with cluster size
   - Supports asynchronous processing of large datasets
   - Allows status monitoring and cancellation
   - Results can be retrieved in pages
   
2. Direct Search (/{entityName}/{modelVersion}):
   - Synchronous, in-memory search
   - Designed for small to medium datasets
   - Limited by maximum result set size (default: 1000, max: 10000)
   - Non-distributed (executes on single node)
   - Configurable timeout and result limits
   - Returns immediate streaming results

All endpoints support:
- Point-in-time queries using ISO 8601 datetime format
- Complex search conditions using GroupConditionDto
- Model-specific searches by entity name and version

### SQL Schema
Operations for managing SQL schemas and tables, including generation from entity models
and configuration of database views.

### Edge Messaging
APIs for handling edge message communication and processing.

## Authentication

This API uses **OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant** for machine-to-machine authentication.

### Getting Started
1. **Create a machine-to-machine (M2M) user** through the client management API (requires SUPER_USER role)
2. **Obtain an access token** using the client credentials via the OAuth token endpoint
3. **Authenticate requests** by including the access token in the Authorization header: `Bearer <access_token>`

### Authentication Flow
- **Technical User Management**: Create, list, reset credentials, and delete M2M clients for your organization
- **Token Issuance**: Standard OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow - no prior authentication required
- **Bearer Token Authentication**: All protected API endpoints require a valid JWT bearer token
- **Role-Based Access Control**: Different endpoints require specific roles (USER, ADMIN, M2M, SUPER_USER)

### User Account Management
- **Account Information**: Retrieve current user account details, tenant information, and roles
- **Subscription Management**: Access subscription information, limits, and feature toggles
- **Multi-tenant Support**: All operations are scoped to the authenticated user's legal entity, a.k.a tenant

### Security Features
- **JWT Tokens**: Secure, stateless authentication with configurable expiration
- **Role-based Authorization**: Access control based on user roles
- **Tenant Isolation**: Data and operations are isolated by legal entity boundaries
- **Credential Management**: Secure client secret generation and rotation capabilities

tags.name: Entity Management
tags.description:
APIs for managing entities including creation, updates, and statistics retrieval.

A note on transaction handling:
* All changes are executed transactionally
* Collections are processed in transactional batches defined by `transactionWindow`
* Collections exceeding `transactionWindow` size are automatically split into multiple transactional batches

A note on transitions:
* Normal transitions are explicitly configured in the workflow and move entities between different states
* Loopback transitions are virtual transitions that loop back to the same state without explicit configuration
* Loopback transitions trigger the first allowable automated exit transition, enabling subsequent automated workflow traversal

tags.name: OAuth, OIDC Providers
tags.description: API for managing trusted external OIDC providers for user authentication and authorization.

tags.name: Entity Model, Workflow
tags.description: APIs for exporting and importing entity model workflows.

tags.name: OAuth, Keys
tags.description: API for managing JWT signing key-pairs for OAuth 2.0 tokens, for issuing, retrieving, invalidating, reactivating, and deleting JWT key-pairs for different token audiences (human users and technical users/service accounts)

tags.name: Entity, Audit
tags.description: APIs for searching and retrieving entity audit events.

Model Lifecycle Rules:
- Entity models must be locked before any entities can be saved using that model

- Models can only be deleted when unlocked and when no entities reference them

Change Level Control:
Models support hierarchical change levels (from least to most impactful):
- ARRAY_LENGTH: Only allows UniTypeArray width increases
- ARRAY_ELEMENTS: Permits MultiTypeArray changes without new types
- TYPE: Allows type modifications
- STRUCTURAL: Permits fundamental model changes

When a change level is set, all less impactful changes are automatically allowed.

get.summary: Retrieve information about the current user's account, including current subscription.
get.description: Fetch information related to the current user's account, such as legal entity, roles, and current subscription.

200.description: Current user's account information with current subscription details

get.summary: Retrieve all subscriptions available for the current user's legal entity.
get.description: Fetch all subscription details associated with the legal entity of the current user.

200.description: Collection of all subscriptions for the user's legal entity

get.description:
Retrieves audit events for a specific entity with cursor-based pagination.
Results are ordered by event utc time (newest first).
Maximum search period is 180 days. Default period is 10 days when one of the boundaries is not defined.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: Identifier of the entity to retrieve audit events for

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: Filter by specific audit event types. If not specified, defaults to all event types except System. Note: Including System events may increase latency and load on the system. Use System events filtering with caution.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: Filter by event severity level

parameters.name: fromUtcTime
parameters.description: Filter events from this timestamp (inclusive)

parameters.name: toUtcTime
parameters.description: Filter events until this timestamp (exclusive)

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Filter by transaction identifier

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the `nextCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the next page of results. Omit for the first page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of audit events to return per page

get.description:
Retrieves a list of all active machine-to-machine (M2M) clients (OAuth 2.0 clients) to the current legal entity.
These users authenticate via client credentials and act on behalf of applications, not humans.

Returns the client IDs of all M2M clients that are currently active
and available for authentication.

**Authorization Required:** SUPER_USER role

200.description: List of M2M clients returned successfully

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred

post.description:
Creates a new machine-to-machine (M2M)client for API authentication via OAuth 2.0.

The created user will have M2M role permissions, necessary for getting the bearer token.

**Authorization Required:** SUPER_USER role

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred

delete.description:
Deletes a M2M client and invalidates all associated credentials.

This operation cannot be undone without a support ticket. Any applications using this client's
credentials will immediately lose access and must be reconfigured with new credentials.

**Authorization Required:** SUPER_USER role

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client ID of the M2M client to delete

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or malformed

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred

put.description:
Generates a new client secret for an existing M2M client.

This operation invalidates the current client secret and generates a new one.
Any applications using the old secret will need to be updated with the new credentials.

**Authorization Required:** SUPER_USER role

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The client ID of the M2M client whose secret should be reset

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or malformed

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred

get.description: Returns statistics for entities grouped by model name and version.

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for statistics in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to current consistency time if not provided

get.description: Returns statistics for entities grouped by model name, version, and state.

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for statistics in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to current consistency time if not provided

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Optional list of states for which to calculate statistics. If not provided, statistics will be calculated for all current workflow states

parameters.description: Name of the entity model

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version number of the entity model

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for statistics in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to current consistency time if not provided

parameters.name: states
parameters.description: Optional list of states for which to calculate statistics. If not provided, statistics will be calculated for all current workflow states

get.description: Returns statistics for entities of a specific model name and version.

parameters.name: modelVersion

parameters.name: pointInTime

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity to get

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for loading the entity, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to the current consistency time of the system if not provided.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Load the entity as it was at the end of the specified transaction with the given transactionId

laureates.motivation: "for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"
"for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"

400.description: Conflicting request paramters (both pointInTime and transactionId provided)

example.title: Bad Request

delete.description: Deletes a single entity by Id

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity to delete

get.description:
Retrieves the change history metadata for a specific entity.

Returns a stream of metadata records describing each change made to the entity, including:
- Transaction ID that made the change
- Timestamp when the change occurred
- User who made the change
- Type of change (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE)
- Number of fields changed

Common use cases:
- Audit trail review
- Change tracking
- Compliance reporting
- Debugging entity state changes

Note:
- Changes are returned in chronological order
- The pointInTime parameter allows viewing the change history as it existed at a specific time

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity to get change history for

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for loading the entity changes, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to the current consistency time of the system if not provided.

get.description:
Retrieves all entities for a given model name and version, with pagination support.
Results are returned as a stream of JSON objects.

Common use cases:
- Bulk data retrieval
- Data migration
- Reporting

Note:
- For large datasets, consider using the search API with snapshots instead.
- To find out how many entities there are, use the entity statistics endpoints.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Name of the entity model to retrieve.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version number of the entity model

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of entities to return per page. Must be greater than 0.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve, starting from 0. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for loading the entities, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to the current consistency time of the system if not provided.

laureates.motivation: "for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"
"for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"
"for studies of how institutions are formed and affect prosperity"
"for studies of how institutions are formed and affect prosperity"
"for studies of how institutions are formed and affect prosperity"

value.title: Bad Request

delete.summary: Delete entities of a model and version
delete.description: Deletes entities for a given model name and version which existed at the consistency time of the system when the request is launched by provided condition or all entities if condition is not provided.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Name of the entity model to delete

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version number of the entity model

parameters.name: transactionSize
parameters.description: Maximum number of entities to delete in a single transaction. Higher values may improve performance but increase memory usage.

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for selecting the entities for deletion, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to the consistency time of the system if not provided.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: Include the list of deleted entity IDs in the response. When false, only returns statistics.

Physics Nobel Prize Search.summary: Find VALIDATED physics Nobel prizes with neural networks research

Family Member Search.summary: Find married family members born after 1998

200.description: Deletion process was successful. In case there were entities that could not be deletedthe response will contain information about that

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: String length of the schema name is outside of the bounds [1,1024]

put.description:
Updates a collection of entities. If any of the entities are not found,
the request will fail and no entities will be updated.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the input payload

parameters.name: transactionWindow
parameters.description: Maximum number of entities per transaction batch

parameters.name: transactionTimeoutMillis
parameters.description: Maximum time in milliseconds allowed for transaction completion

parameters.name: waitForConsistencyAfter
parameters.description: If true, waits for consistency after operation completes

Mixed Entity Updates.summary: Example of updating multiple entities of different types

post.description:
Saves a collection of entities. Each entity can be from a different model and version.

Path Parameters:
- format: The format of the input payload (e.g., JSON, XML)

Request Body:
- A list of CreatePayload objects, each containing entity data and model information

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the input payload

parameters.name: transactionWindow
parameters.description: Maximum number of entities per transaction batch

parameters.name: transactionTimeoutMillis
parameters.description: Maximum time in milliseconds allowed for transaction completion

parameters.name: waitForConsistencyAfter
parameters.description: If true, waits for consistency after operation completes

Mixed Entity Collection.summary: Example of multiple entities of different types

put.summary: Update Single with a loopback transition
put.description:
Updates a single entity with a loopback transition.

Path Parameters:
- format: The format of the input payload (e.g., JSON, XML)
- entityId: The UUID of the entity to update

Request Body:
- Entity data in the specified format

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the input payload

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity to update

parameters.name: transactionTimeoutMillis
parameters.description: Maximum time in milliseconds allowed for transaction completion. Operation will fail if it takes longer than this timeout.

parameters.name: waitForConsistencyAfter
parameters.description: If true, waits for the consistency time to pass before responding. May increase response time but guarantees data consistency when returning, so that subsequent calls will see the updated data.

JSON Example.summary: An example of a JSON request body

laureates.motivation: "for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"
"for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"

XML Example.summary: An example of an XML request body
XML Example.value:
<PrizeDto>
  <category>physics</category>
  <laureates>
    <laureates>
      <firstname>John</firstname>
      <surname>Hopfield</surname>
      <id>1037</id>
      <motivation>"for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"</motivation>
      <share>2</share>
    </laureates>
    <laureates>
      <firstname>Geoffrey</firstname>
      <surname>Hinton</surname>
      <id>1038</id>
      <motivation>"for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"</motivation>
      <share>2</share>
    </laureates>
  </laureates>
  <year>2024</year>
</PrizeDto>

put.description:
Updates a single entity.

Path Parameters:
- format: The format of the input payload (e.g., JSON, XML)
- entityId: The UUID of the entity to update
- transition: The transition to apply to the entity

Request Body:
- Entity data in the specified format

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the input payload

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the entity to update

parameters.name: transition
parameters.description: The transition state to apply to the entity (e.g., 'UPDATE', 'PUBLISH')

parameters.name: transactionTimeoutMillis
parameters.description: Maximum time in milliseconds allowed for transaction completion. Operation will fail if it takes longer than this timeout.

parameters.name: waitForConsistencyAfter
parameters.description: If true, waits for the consistency time to pass before responding. May increase response time but guarantees data consistency when returning, so that subsequent calls will see the updated data.

JSON Example.summary: An example of a JSON request body

post.description:
Saves a new entity or a collection of entities of the same type.

Path Parameters:
* format: The format of the input payload (e.g., JSON, XML)
* entityName: The name of the entity model
* modelVersion: The version number of the entity model

Request Body:
- A string containing the entity data in the specified format

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the input payload

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Name of the entity model

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version number of the entity model

parameters.name: transactionWindow
parameters.description: Maximum number of entities to process in a single transaction

parameters.name: transactionTimeoutMillis
parameters.description: Maximum time in milliseconds for transaction completion

parameters.name: waitForConsistencyAfter
parameters.description: If true, waits for consistency after the operation completes

delete.summary: Delete multiple edge messages by IDs
delete.description: Deletes multiple stored edge messages using their unique identifiers, including the associated payload blobs. Messages are deleted in batches according to the specified transaction size.

parameters.name: transactionSize
parameters.description: Number of messages to delete per transaction batch

requestBody.description: List of message IDs to delete. All IDs must be version 1 (time-based) UUIDs.

400.description: Invalid UUID format or not a time-based UUID

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: UUID 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000 is not a time-based UUID (version 1)

post.description: Creates and stores a new edge message with the provided payload and AMQP-aligned headers. The message is processed according to the specified parsing configuration and stored with a unique identifier.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Message subject identifier

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: MIME type of the message payload

parameters.name: Content-Length
parameters.description: Size of the message payload in bytes

parameters.name: Content-Encoding
parameters.description: Character encoding of the payload

parameters.name: X-Message-ID
parameters.description: Custom message identifier

parameters.name: X-User-ID
parameters.description: ID of the message sender

parameters.name: X-Recipient
parameters.description: Intended message recipient

parameters.name: X-Reply-To
parameters.description: Reply-to address for responses

parameters.name: X-Correlation-ID
parameters.description: Correlation ID for message tracking

parameters.name: transactionTimeoutMillis
parameters.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for transaction completion

requestBody.description:
The request body can be either a single JSON object or an array of homomorphic JSON objects.
Each object must contain a 'payload' field with any valid JSON content.
It may also optionally include meta-data fields with a Flat set of key-value pairs.
The meta-data is indexed to enable fast searching by meta-data.

The message will be processed and stored according to this structure.

Nobel Prize Announcement (with payload a.description: Nobel Prize Announcement (with payload and meta-data)

laureates.motivation: for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks
for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks

Nobel Prize Announcement (with payload b.description: Nobel Prize Announcement (with payload but without meta-data)

laureates.motivation: for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks
for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks

400.description: Invalid message format or parsing error

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: Invalid JSON format in message payload

value.title: Payload Too Large
value.detail: Request payload size exceeds maximum allowed limit of 10MB

get.description:
Retrieves a list of all available entity models in the system.

Each model in the response includes its identifier, name, version,
current state (LOCKED/UNLOCKED), and last modification timestamp.

Paging and searching are not yet supported.

Exports an entity model's metadata in the specified format.

Path Parameters:
- converter: The format to export to (e.g., JSON_SCHEMA, SIMPLE_VIEW)
- entityName: The name of the entity model to export
- modelVersion: The version number of the model

The response format depends on the chosen converter:
- JSON_SCHEMA: Returns a JSON Schema representation
- SIMPLE_VIEW: Returns a simplified view of the model structure

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The model name of the entity

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: The model version

parameters.name: converter
parameters.description: The type converter to use

post.description:
Imports or updates an entity model from the provided data.

Path Parameters:
- dataFormat: The format of the input data (e.g., JSON, XML)
- converter: The type converter to use for processing the data (SAMPLE_DATA, JSON_SCHEMA, SIMPLE_VIEW)
- entityName: The name for the entity model
- modelVersion: The version number for the model

Returns the UUID of the created/updated entity model.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The model name of the entity

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: The version number for the model

parameters.name: converter
parameters.description: The type converter to use for processing the data

parameters.name: dataFormat
parameters.description: The format of the input data

Nobel Prize Model.summary: Example of a Nobel Prize entity model

laureates.motivation: "for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"
"for foundational discoveries and inventions that enable machine learning with artificial neural networks"

delete.description:
Deletes an entity model if it meets deletion criteria.

Requirements for deletion:
- Model must be in UNLOCKED state
- No entities can reference this model in the database

Path Parameters:
- entityName: The name of the entity model to delete
- modelVersion: The version number of the model

Returns a confirmation message upon successful deletion.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The model name of the entity

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: The version number of the model

post.description:
Sets or updates the allowed change level for a locked entity model.

Path Parameters:
- entityName: The name of the entity model
- modelVersion: The version number of the model
- changeLevel: The desired change level (ARRAY_LENGTH, ARRAY_ELEMENTS, TYPE, STRUCTURAL) or null to disallow changes

Change levels are hierarchical - allowing a specific level automatically allows all less impactful levels:
1. ARRAY_LENGTH: Only permits increases in UniTypeArray width
2. ARRAY_ELEMENTS: Allows MultiTypeArray changes without new types
3. TYPE: Permits modifications to existing types
4. STRUCTURAL: Allows fundamental model changes

Note: Setting a change level is only meaningful for locked models. An unlocked model always allows all changes.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The model name of the entity

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: The version number of the model

parameters.name: changeLevel
parameters.description:
The allowed change level for the model.
Set to null to disallow all changes.
Valid values: ARRAY_LENGTH, ARRAY_ELEMENTS, TYPE, STRUCTURAL

value.message: model nobel-prize:1 now at change level TYPE

put.description:
Locks an entity model to prevent further modifications.

Path Parameters:
- entityName: The name of the entity model to lock
- modelVersion: The version number of the model

Returns a confirmation message upon successful locking.
Once locked, a model cannot be modified unless explicitly unlocked or a change level is set.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The model name of the entity

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: The version number of the model

put.description:
Attempts to unlock a locked entity model.

Requirements for unlocking:
- No entities can reference this model in the database
- Model must be in LOCKED state

Path Parameters:
- entityName: The name of the entity model to unlock
- modelVersion: The version number of the model

The operation will fail if there are any entities in the database using this model.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: The model name of the entity

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: The version number of the model

get.description:
Exports all workflow configurations for a specific entity type.

Since one entity type can have multiple workflows (selected by workflow-level conditions),
this endpoint returns a collection of all workflows configured for the entity type.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Name of the entity model

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version of the entity model

post.description:
Imports or updates workflow configurations for a specific entity type.

Since workflow name must be unique per entity model, this endpoint will either create
new workflow or update existing workflow with the same name.

The workflow configuration structure is defined by versioned schemas and may vary
depending on the version specified in the configuration.

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Name of the entity model

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version of the entity model

post.description:
Generates and stores a new asymmetric key-pair (public/private) for signing and validating OAuth 2.0 JWT
access tokens.

get.summary: Get current active JWT signing key-pair
get.description: Retrieves information about the currently active JWT signing key-pair for the specified audience.

delete.description:
Deletes a JWT signing key-pair. The key will first be invalidated (if not already)
and then removed from storage.

parameters.name: keyId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (kid) of the key-pair to delete

post.description:
Invalidates a specific JWT signing key-pair.
After invalidation, the key will no longer be used for signing new tokens,
and existing tokens signed with this key pair would not be accepted.

parameters.name: keyId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (kid) of the key-pair to invalidate

post.description:
Reactivates a previously invalidated JWT signing key-pair.
This allows the key to be used for signing and validating tokens again.
This operation is idempotent - if the key-pair is already active, it returns the current state.

parameters.name: keyId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (kid) of the key-pair to reactivate

200.description: JWT key-pair reactivated successfully or already active

get.description: Retrieves a list of all registered OIDC providers, including both active and inactive providers.

parameters.name: activeOnly
parameters.description: If true, returns only active providers

200.description: List of OIDC providers retrieved successfully

post.summary: Register a new trusted OIDC provider
post.description:
Registers a new external OIDC provider for JWT validation. The provider's public keys will be
discovered from the well-known configuration endpoint and used to validate JWT tokens.

409.description: Provider with this well-known configuration URI already exists

post.summary: Force to reload all OIDC providers and synchronize keys with remote JWKS
post.description:
Reloads all active OIDC provider configurations from the database and synchronizes
cached keys with the remote JWKS endpoints.

Key synchronization: For each provider, this operation fetches the current keys from
the remote JWKS endpoint and invalidates any locally cached keys that no longer exist
in the remote JWKS. This is useful for security when OIDC providers have rotated or
revoked keys.

This operation is useful when you want to ensure all nodes have the latest OIDC provider
configurations and that any revoked keys are no longer trusted.

delete.description:
Deletes an OIDC provider and all its associated JWK keys.
The provider will first be invalidated (if not already) and then removed from storage.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the OIDC provider to delete

patch.description:
Updates configuration for an OIDC provider.

Note: Updating the issuers list immediately deletes all cached keys for this provider.
This ensures that JWTs from issuers that are no longer trusted cannot be validated using
previously cached keys. The keys will be re-fetched from the remote JWKS endpoint with the
new issuer configuration when they are next needed for JWT validation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the OIDC provider

post.description:
Invalidates an OIDC provider, marking it as inactive and invalidating all loaded public keys
associated with this provider. The provider configuration is retained but will no longer be
used for JWT validation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the OIDC provider to invalidate

post.description:
Reactivates a previously invalidated OIDC provider. The provider will be marked as active
and can be used for JWT validation again.
This operation is idempotent - if the provider is already active, it returns the current state.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the OIDC provider to reactivate

200.description: OIDC provider reactivated successfully or already active

post.summary: Obtain access token for M2M client
post.description:
Authenticates a M2M client using client credentials and returns an access token.

This endpoint implements the standard OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant, designed for
machine-to-machine authentication. The client must authenticate using HTTP Basic Authentication,
where the client_id and client_secret are provided in the Authorization header.

The returned access token can be used to authenticate subsequent API requests using the Bearer token scheme.

**Note:** This endpoint does not require an existing access token, as it serves as the authentication entry point.

400.description: Bad request - Invalid credentials or malformed request

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred

get.summary: Get a stream data configuration by ID
get.description: Retrieves a specific stream data configuration by its UUID.

parameters.name: configId
parameters.description: UUID of the configuration to retrieve

put.summary: Update an existing stream data configuration
put.description: Updates an existing stream data configuration definition.

requestBody.description: Stream data configuration with updated values

post.summary: Save a new stream data configuration
post.description: Creates and persists a new stream data configuration definition.

delete.description: Deletes a stream data configuration by its UUID.

parameters.name: configId
parameters.description: UUID of the configuration to delete

get.description: Returns all available stream data configurations.

200.description: List of all stream data configurations

delete.description: Deletes entities matching the stream data request criteria.

requestBody.description: Stream data request defining the entities to delete

200.description: Deletion result with counts and any errors

get.description: Exports all stream data configurations as a container for backup or transfer.

200.description: Container with all stream data configurations

get.summary: Export stream data configurations by entity class
get.description: Exports all stream data configurations associated with a specific entity class.

parameters.name: entityClass
parameters.description: Fully qualified class name of the entity

200.description: Container with stream data configurations for the entity class

get.summary: Export stream data configurations by IDs
get.description: Exports specific stream data configurations identified by their UUIDs.

parameters.name: includeIds
parameters.description: List of configuration UUIDs to export

200.description: Container with the requested stream data configurations

post.description: Retrieves paginated stream data based on the provided request definition, including conditions, columns, and pagination parameters.

requestBody.description: Stream data request containing definition, pagination, and point-in-time parameters

200.description: Stream data fetch result containing rows and pagination info

post.description: Imports stream data configurations from a container. Can optionally fail if configurations already exist.

parameters.name: failOnExists
parameters.description: If true, fail when a configuration already exists; if false, skip existing configurations

requestBody.description: Container with stream data configurations to import

409.description: Configuration already exists (when failOnExists is true)

get.summary: List index configurations for an entity class
get.description: Returns all index configurations available for the specified entity class.

parameters.name: entityClass
parameters.description: Fully qualified class name of the entity

post.description: Returns the original and optimized query execution plan for the given entity class, condition, and alias definitions.

requestBody.description: Query plan request containing entity class, condition, and alias definitions

200.description: Query plan with original and optimized versions

get.summary: Get full statistics for all tables
get.description: Returns detailed execution statistics for all tracked tables, including per-operation breakdowns and minute-by-minute statistics.

get.summary: Get brief statistics for all tables
get.description: Returns summary execution statistics for all tracked tables without per-operation or minute-level details.
Clears all accumulated CQL execution statistics for all tables. This operation cannot be undone.

get.summary: Get statistics for a specific table
get.description: Returns detailed execution statistics for a specific Cassandra table, including timing distributions and operation breakdowns.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the Cassandra table, case sensitive, including quotes if needed

404.description: Table not found or has no statistics

get.description: Returns a sorted list of all Cassandra table names that have execution statistics tracked.

post.description:
Submits an asynchronous search job for creating a persistent search result set for large datasets.

This endpoint initiates an asynchronous search operation that:
1. Validates the search criteria against the specified entity model
2. Creates a persistent search result set of matching entities
3. Returns a UUID that can be used to:
   - Monitor the search job progress (/search/async/{jobId}/status)
   - Retrieve paginated results (/search/async/{jobId})
   - Cancel the search job if needed (/search/async/{jobId}/cancel)

Search jobs are temporary and have a limited lifetime:
- Each search job has an automatic expiration date
- Expired search jobs are automatically deleted by the system
- The expiration date can be retrieved using GET /search/async/{jobId}/status
- Plan to retrieve your data before the search job expires

The search job runs in the background, allowing handling of large datasets
without timeout concerns.

If no request body is provided or an empty request body is sent, all entities of the specified model and version will be included in the search results.

Query Structure:
The search condition is a tree of predicates that can include:
1. Simple conditions - search within entity data using JSONPath
2. Lifecycle conditions - search based on entity lifecycle (state, creationDate, previousTransition)
3. Group conditions - combine multiple conditions with AND/OR operators

Operator Types (Predicates)
Available Operations:

1. Basic Comparison
- EQUALS: Exact match
- NOT_EQUAL: Non-matching values
- IS_NULL, NOT_NULL: Null checks
- GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN: Numeric/date comparisons
- GREATER_OR_EQUAL, LESS_OR_EQUAL: Inclusive comparisons
- BETWEEN, BETWEEN_INCLUSIVE: Range checks

2. String Operations (Case-Sensitive)
- CONTAINS: Substring match
- NOT_CONTAINS: Negative substring match
- STARTS_WITH, NOT_STARTS_WITH: Prefix matching
- ENDS_WITH, NOT_ENDS_WITH: Suffix matching
- MATCHES_PATTERN: Regular expression match
- LIKE: SQL-style pattern matching

3. Case-Insensitive String Operations
- IEQUALS, INOT_EQUAL: Case-insensitive equality
- ICONTAINS, INOT_CONTAINS: Case-insensitive substring
- ISTARTS_WITH, INOT_STARTS_WITH: Case-insensitive prefix
- IENDS_WITH, INOT_ENDS_WITH: Case-insensitive suffix

4. State Tracking
- IS_UNCHANGED: Field hasn't changed
- IS_CHANGED: Field has changed

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Name of the entity model to search

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version of the entity model

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for the report, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to the current consistency time of the system if not provided.

200.description: Async search job submitted successfully. Note that the search job will expire after a certain period.

get.summary: Retrieve paginated results from an async search job
get.description:
Retrieves a page of results from a previously submitted async search job.
To find out how many entities were found, call the search job status endpoint.

The results are sorted in descending order by entity id.

The results are returned in a paginated format, with:
- Configurable page size (default: 10)
- Zero-based page numbering
- Optional point-in-time specification for the data being retrieved

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: UUID of the search job to retrieve results from

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Zero-based page number

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for loading the entities, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2035-01-01T12:00:00Z'). Defaults to the point-in-time of the report if not provided.

404.description: Search job not found or expired

400.description: Invalid parameters (malformed point-in-time or invalid page parameters)

put.summary: Cancel a running async search job
put.description:
Attempts to cancel a running async search job. The operation:
- Only succeeds if the search job is in RUNNING state
- Returns the cancellation result and final status
- Invalidates the search job entry if cancellation succeeds

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: UUID of the search job to cancel

400.description: Search job is not in RUNNING state

get.description:
Retrieves the current status of an async search job. The response includes:
- Current status (one of: RUNNING, FAILED, CANCELLED, SUCCESSFUL, NOT_FOUND)
- Number of entities collected
- Calculation time
- Creation timestamp
- Finish timestamp (if completed)
- Expiration date

Note: The NOT_FOUND status occurs in rare race conditions where the search job exists when the endpoint is called but is deleted during data retrieval.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: UUID of the search job to check status for

post.description:
Executes a direct, in-memory search for entities without creating a persistent search job. This endpoint:
- Returns results immediately as a streaming response
- Is optimized for smaller result sets
- Has configurable timeout and result limits
- Supports point-in-time querying

The results are sorted in descending order by entity id.

If no request body is provided or an empty request body is sent, all entities of the specified model and version
will be returned (subject to the limit parameter).

Best suited for:
- Interactive searches requiring immediate results
- Queries expected to return limited number of entities
- UI components with real-time search functionality

Limitations:
- Maximum result limit: 10000 entities (this will silently limit the result to 10000)
- Default result limit: 1000 entities
- Default timeout: 60000 milliseconds

parameters.name: entityName
parameters.description: Name of the entity model to search

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: Version of the entity model

parameters.name: pointInTime
parameters.description: The point-in-time for searching the entities, in ISO 8601 format. Defaults to the consistency time of the system if not provided.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of rows to return. You can specify a limit of up to 10000 and defaults to 1000 if not provided.

parameters.name: timeoutMillis
parameters.description: The maximum time to wait for the query to complete, in milliseconds, and defaults to 60000 if not provided.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

properties.description: Additional properties specific to the problem type

client_id.description: The client identifier for the M2M client

error.description: Error codes from RFC 6749 Section 5.2 (OAuth 2.0 Error Response) identifying the type of error

error_description.example: The request is missing required parameters

error_uri.description: Optional URI to documentation about the error

state.description: Current state of the entity in its workflow

transitionForLatestSave.description: The transition that triggered the latest save

data.description: The entity data as a JSON object

attachEntity.description: Whether to attach entity data to the function call

calculationNodesTags.description: Comma-separated list of calculation node tags

name.description: Name of the function that returns boolean

criterion.description: Optional criterion to check before calling an expensive function, used when the result can be confidently determined from entity data

access_token.description: The JWT access token for API authentication

token_type.description: The type of token issued (currently always 'Bearer')

expires_in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the access token

refresh_token.description: The refresh token for obtaining new access tokens

scope.description: The scope of the access token, as per RFC 6749 Section 3.3. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.3

id.description: ID for this OIDC provider entity

wellKnownConfigUri.description: URI to the OIDC provider's well-known configuration endpoint

active.description: Whether this OIDC provider is currently active and used for JWT validation

createdAt.description: When this OIDC provider was registered

issuers.description: List of allowed issuer URIs from this OIDC provider. When present and non-empty, JWT validation requires the 'iss' claim to match one of these values.

wellKnownConfigUri.description: URI to the OIDC provider's well-known configuration endpoint

issuers.description: Optional but highly recommended list of allowed issuer URIs from this OIDC provider. When present, JWT validation will require the 'iss' claim to match one of these values. When set to null or empty array, the 'iss' claim validation is skipped.

reactivateKeys.description: If true, also reactivates all related JWK keys that were invalidated with this provider

keyId.description: Unique identifier for this key-pair (UUID). Included in JWT header as 'kid' claim.

publicKey.description: Base64-encoded public key in X.509 SubjectPublicKeyInfo format.

validFrom.description: When the key-pair becomes valid. Defaults to current date-time if not specified.

validTo.description: When the key-pair expires. Defaults to validFrom + <configured validity, default is 365 days> if not specified.

invalidateCurrent.description: If true, invalidates the currently active key-pair for this audience.

invalidateGracePeriodSec.description: Number of seconds to keep the old key valid after invalidation. Only applicable when invalidateCurrent is true.

gracePeriodSec.description: Number of seconds to keep the key valid after invalidation. Default is 0 (immediate invalidation).

attachEntity.description: Whether to attach entity data to the function call

calculationNodesTags.description: Comma-separated list of calculation node tags

asyncResult.description: Whether to await the result asynchronously, outside of the transaction

crossoverToAsyncMs.description: Crossover delay to switch to asynchronous processing (ms), effective only when asyncResult is true

type.description: Type of the processor (externalized or scheduled)

delayMs.description: Delay in milliseconds before executing the transition

transition.description: The transition to execute after waiting delayMs

timeoutMs.description: Timeout in milliseconds for executing the transition task, after which it will be expired

transitions.description: List of possible transitions from this state

next.description: Target state code for this transition

manual.description: Whether this transition requires manual triggering

disabled.description: Flag indicating if the transition is disabled

processors.description: List of processors to execute for this transition

version.description: Version of the workflow configuration schema

initialState.description: Initial state for entities in this workflow

states.description: Map of state codes to state definitions

active.description: Flag indicating if the workflow is active

workflows.description: Array of workflow configurations to import

importMode.description: Import mode for handling existing workflows

issuers.description: Optional but highly recommended list of allowed issuer URIs from this OIDC provider. When present, JWT validation will require the 'iss' claim to match one of these values. When set to null or empty array, the 'iss' claim validation is skipped.

size.description: Number of elements in the current page

totalElements.description: Total number of elements across all pages

content.description: List of entity results for the current page

expirationDate.description: When the search job will expire and be automatically deleted

entitiesCount.description: Number of entities found by the search

calculationTimeMillis.description: Time taken to calculate the search job in milliseconds

createTime.description: When the search job was initiated

finishTime.description: When the search job completed (null if still running)

TableTimeStatsDTO.description: Detailed execution statistics for a Cassandra table, including timing distributions and operation breakdowns

tableStats.description: Detailed timing statistics for all operations on this table

operationStats.description: Per-operation timing statistics breakdown (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, etc.)

TimeStatDataDTO.description: Timing statistics data with automatic unit selection for optimal readability

total.description: Total cumulative execution time across all operations, converted to seconds for readability

last.description: Most recent execution time in nanoseconds

measure.description: Suggested conversion factor from nanoseconds to the recommended display unit. Divide nanosecond values by this to get values in the suggested unit.

measureDesc.description: Suggested unit abbreviation for displaying timing values based on magnitude analysis

entityName.description: The name of the entity model

modelVersion.description: The version number of the entity model

workflows.description: Collection of workflow configurations for the entity model

clientId.description: The client identifier for the M2M client

creationDate.description: The date and time when the M2M client was created

lastUpdateDate.description: The date and time when the M2M client was last updated

legalId.description: Legal entity identifier of the actor

transactionId.description: Transaction identifier related to this event

entityModel.description: Type of the entity related to this event (model.version)

entityId.description: Identifier of the entity related to this event

system.description: Flag indicating whether this is a system-level event

utcTime.description: UTC time when the event occurred

microsTime.description: time in microseconds when the event occurred

hasNext.description: Indicates whether there are more results available

nextCursor.description: Cursor to use for fetching the next page of results. Can be omit when hasNext is false.

reason.description: The reason why the criterion returned false

state.description: State of the entity where the event occurred within the state machine

eventType.description: Type of the state machine event

success.description: Whether the state machine execution was successful

processorClassName.description: Fully qualified class name of the processor

criterion.description: Name of the criterion that was not matched

reason.description: Reason why the criterion was not matched

processNames.description: List of process names that are paused

state.description: The state of the entity when the state machine flow was started

stateProcessClassName.description: Fully qualified class name of the state process

criterion.description: Name of the criterion that was not matched

reason.description: Reason why the criterion was not matched

transition.description: Name of the transition that was made
Name of the transition that was not found

workflowName.description: Name of the workflow that was found
Name of the workflow that was skipped

errorTime.description: Time when an error occurred, if applicable

doneTime.description: Time when the operation completed, if applicable

queueName.description: Name of the queue involved in the operation, if applicable

shardId.description: Identifier of the shard involved in the operation, if applicable

status.description: Status of the system operation, if applicable

data.description: Object containing specific event data with technical information

description.description: Human-readable description of why the workflow stopped

rejectedTransitions.description: If stopped due to criteria rejections, the transitions that were rejected

id.description: Unique identifier for the legal entity

legalEntityId.description: Identifier for the associated legal entity

timeIntervalBound.description: The time interval bound for the entitlement

featureToggles.description: A map of feature toggles with their values
